parts.text: {"word":"comprometer","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"Poner en peligro o riesgo.","english_definition":"To endanger or put at risk.","examples":[{"sentence":"Su imprudencia comprometió la seguridad de todos.","translation":"His recklessness endangered everyone's safety."},{"sentence":"La falta de fondos compromete el éxito del proyecto.","translation":"The lack of funds jeopardizes the success of the project."}],"collocations":["Comprometer la seguridad","Comprometer el futuro","Comprometer la salud"],"synonyms":["arriesgar","peligrar","poner en riesgo"],"antonyms":["proteger","salvaguardar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"Obligar a alguien a hacer algo, especialmente algo que no quiere hacer.","english_definition":"To obligate someone to do something, especially something they don't want to do.","examples":[{"sentence":"No me comprometas a tomar una decisión ahora.","translation":"Don't obligate me to make a decision now."},{"sentence":"Se comprometió a ayudar, aunque no quería.","translation":"He committed himself to helping, even though he didn't want to."}],"collocations":["Comprometer a alguien a algo","Comprometerse a ayudar"],"synonyms":["obligar","forzar","compeler"],"antonyms":["liberar","eximir"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","pronominal","definition":"Comprometerse: contraer una obligación, especialmente un matrimonio.","english_definition":"To commit oneself; to become engaged, especially to be married.","examples":[{"sentence":"Se comprometieron el año pasado y se casarán en primavera.","translation":"They got engaged last year and will get married in the spring."},{"sentence":"Me comprometo a hacer todo lo posible para ayudar.","translation":"I commit myself to doing everything possible to help."}],"collocations":["Comprometerse con alguien","Comprometerse a hacer algo"],"synonyms":["obligarse","prometer","jurar"],"antonyms":["desentenderse","retractarse"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","pronominal","definition":"Comprometerse: involucrarse en algo, especialmente en algo controvertido.","english_definition":"To get involved in something, especially something controversial.","examples":[{"sentence":"No quiero comprometerme en esa discusión.","translation":"I don't want to get involved in that discussion."},{"sentence":"Se comprometió con la causa de los derechos humanos.","translation":"He got involved in the cause of human rights."}],"collocations":["Comprometerse con una causa","Comprometerse en una discusión"],"synonyms":["involucrarse","participar","implicarse"],"antonyms":["abstenerse","desvincularse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Del latín compromittere, compuesto de com- (con, junto) y promittere (prometer).","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/kom.pɾomeˈteɾ/","syllables":"com-pro-me-ter"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["comprometo","comprometes","compromete","comprometemos","comprometéis","comprometen"],"past_simple":["comprometí","comprometiste","comprometió","comprometimos","comprometisteis","comprometieron"],"future_simple":["comprometeré","comprometerás","comprometerá","comprometeremos","comprometeréis","comprometerán"],"present_subjunctive":["comprometa","comprometas","comprometa","comprometamos","comprometáis","comprometan"],"past_subjunctive":["comprometiera/comprometiese","comprometieras/comprometieses","comprometiera/comprometiese","comprometiéramos/comprometiésemos","comprometierais/comprometieseis","comprometieran/comprometiesen"],"imperative":["compromete (tú)","comprometa (usted)","comprometamos (nosotros)","comprometed (vosotros)","comprometan (ustedes)"]}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Comprometer' es un verbo versátil con varios significados importantes. Principalmente, significa poner algo o alguien en peligro o riesgo. También significa obligar a alguien a hacer algo, a menudo en contra de su voluntad. Como verbo pronominal ('comprometerse'), puede significar contraer una obligación, especialmente un matrimonio, o involucrarse en algo, a menudo controvertido. El contexto es crucial para entender el significado preciso.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo estoy comprometiendo.","correct":"Yo me estoy comprometiendo.","note":"When referring to getting engaged or involved, the reflexive form 'comprometerse' is necessary."},{"incorrect":"El fuego compromete a la casa.","correct":"El fuego compromete la casa.","note":"'Comprometer' doesn't require the preposition 'a' when used in the sense of endangering something."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["comprometido (adjective: engaged, committed, risky)","compromiso (noun: commitment, engagement, risk)"],"phrases":["Estar comprometido (to be engaged)","Tener un compromiso (to have an engagement)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_corpus":"High","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"'Comprometer' is a versatile verb with several important meanings. It can mean to endanger something, to obligate someone, or, as a reflexive verb ('comprometerse'), to get engaged or involved. The context is key to understanding the intended meaning. It's important to distinguish between the transitive and reflexive uses of the verb."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"La contaminación puede comprometer la salud de los niños.","translation":"Pollution can endanger the health of children.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"Endanger"},{"sentence":"No quiero comprometerte a hacer algo que no quieres.","translation":"I don't want to obligate you to do something you don't want to do.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"Obligate"},{"sentence":"Se van a comprometer en Navidad.","translation":"They are going to get engaged at Christmas.","type":"pronominal","meaning_category":"Get engaged"},{"sentence":"No me quiero comprometer con ningún partido político.","translation":"I don't want to get involved with any political party.","type":"pronominal","meaning_category":"Get involved"}]}
